everyone has a role to play and all

Mr President this week has been
dominated by discussions of the many and
serious problems that humankind faces
most of these pressing problems do not
respect National borders
we are now more than ever in the history
of humankind
in a state of mutual Reliance and
dependence
the problems created by some of us often
have dire consequences for others
A disruption in production in one part
of the world impacts the well-being of
people in another
hateful rhetoric that is used for
political gain in one country can spread
with a speed of light across borders and
poison public discourse in another
but there are other and more uplifting
parts of this reality
solutions that are discovered in any

new ideas and culture in science and in

being interconnected also means that
people are aware of each other's
Humanity
but sadly at the same time when we need
it the most
multilateralism is in serious crisis
I believe that we are at a critical
juncture that when we look back at these

or these times will be considered a
moment of strength
when the International System showed

we need to take the Long View and

how leaders Act and how institutions

this means the United Nations and this

Mr President this year marks the halfway
point for the ambitious sustainable
Redevelopment goals set out in 2015.
it is estimated that only 15 percent of
the sdgs are currently on track for
completion by 2030.
plainly speaking it is half time and we
are down by a big margin
during this week some positive steps
have been taken at the sdg summit but it
will be actions not words that count
Iceland presented the second voluntary
National Review in July
as with many others we have a mixed
story to tell some of our goals are on
track others are simply not
my government remains committed to the
timely implementation of the sustainable
development goals and agenda 2030.
as for most of us
the second half will be decisive
the Paris agreement is also in Jeopardy
over the past months we have witnessed
The increased intensity of climate

patterns
wildfires are battering every corner of

this is an existential threat to us all

Mr President December marks the 75 fifth

it is a milestone worth celebrating
the world has long since learned that
when the rights of people are denied in

the effects will be felt by others
just as domestic violence is a societal

Matter brutal treatment of citizens in

human rights are a key pillar of

based on the conviction that all human
rights are Universal
invisible interrelated
interdependent and mutually reinforcing

we can all do better and we should all

women and girls in Afghanistan can't go

I salute The Bravery of The Women Within

in Iran the authorities continue to deny

we should all listen to the voices of

we are seeing degradation in the rights

all of of all the things that people

I simply can never understand why people

the freedom to love
and be loved for who they are

the fact of our equality

we do not have gender equality in

equality that has simply made us strong

and there are so many other places

cases of people being arbitrarily

there is a trend in the direction of

they spread suspicion pedal

sometimes it is difficult to talk to

the people of this organization and us

the United Nations must be modern and
chains with times
this system a miracle of the human
